data.title: A Saturday evening pizza
data.text: My husband & I enjoyed the dining experience in this restaurant/sports bar located in the heart of the city right next to the quaint train station. We were seated at a high top since the restaurant was nearly filled at 7:20 PM. Our waitress, Abby, was very attentive without being overbearing. The Bloody Marys were wonderful. We ordered a "Train Wreck" pizza on a thin crust. Everything met our expectations. A band was setting up but it didn't start until 20 minutes after we left.

data.title: A fun place to visit!
data.text: The food is pretty good, but the main feature here is that there is something always going on.  Noise level is a little high, but lots of energy.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Live band and great food!
data.text: Great local atmosphere! Wings were huge! Band was great! Drinks were great! Large enough for group get togethers. Also has "comfort" food that I was told was very good.

data.title: Keeping it Local
data.text:
Friendly, prompt, attentive service.
Great selection of seasonal craft beers on tap.
Basic "bar" food menu, but very diverse, all ethnic groups represented from Cuban to Rueben!
American (burgers) to Italian (pizza), fried pickles and a quesadilla thrown in for good measure.
Limited entree choices, but I'm ok with that - not my main reason for going to a tap house, but nice to know there are options. 
If you serve beer, you better serve soft, warm pretzels! And they do! 
And they don't disappoint!!
Served with either beer cheese or spinach dip... Ask for both, I hate making decisions after 8 pm :)
Kudos on the ramekin portion of dip, the Flying Saucer could take a queue from you and up their portion game.
Sandwiches and wraps come with "house cut" fries - husband says they are average.
I upgraded to a more nutritious house salad, worth the extra $2.

Pleasant evening for dining outside with our pup on the pet friendly  deck patio.   TV also available to watch your favorite sports team - at least until they trot out Soria.

One small critique: Our waitress, sweet girl, needs to be coached on not referring to her female diners as "guys". 
"Be right with you guys" "what can I get you guys" "how is everything guys" "can I get you guys anything else" "thank you guys"
Just a sampling.

We supported this restaurant because a % of their sales were helping support a gofundme account set up to find a local missing girl - foul play involved.
Thank you Konrad's for stepping up.

data.title: Great Lunch spot
data.text: My favorite lunch item at Konrad's is the Loin King. It is an excellent pork tenderloin served with a nice horseradish mustard sauce. I choose the salad for an additional dollar. A great spot for lunch.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: Cold beer, good service and pretty good food.  Try the bones, chicken nachos or miso chicken salad (I'm pretty sure that is what it is called). Nice covered patio.  Inside can get loud if they have a band!

data.title: Just needed a break from the heat
data.text: We attended the festival and car show this today and after seeing the cars we needed a break from the heat and walking. We have never been to Konrad's before and decided it was time for a beer. The Bartender recommended an excellent Amber Ale for me and my wife had a $4 Bloody Mary. We decided to ordering their onion rings. The brought a large tasty plate of rings and dipping sauce. However they were more crispy than I prefer, but not burnt. We would go back if opportunity presents itself.

data.title: Bands
data.text: I love to see the bands here and the food and drinks are great! They added more seating which was smart for the evening that I went to see the band. and no cover charge!!

data.title: Night out
data.text: The food here is usually very good. There is usually a band on weekends but it's often very loud so it's hard to have conversations with your group.

data.title: Dinner with adult kids
data.text: We stopped here to have dinner with our college age kids before heading to the local wine bar.  The chicken was over cooked , almost burned and the beef had quite a bit of fat in it.  The chicken however on the inside was juicy despite the burned breading.  The waitress was very friendly but the service was kind of slow even though the place was not crowded.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: Food was pretty good and the drinks were decent. A really great place on a slow night but not much room on a busy night. The staff was great though. I will return again.

data.title: Night on the town in Lees Summit
data.text: Nice atmosphere, good food , good service, friendly staff. Right by the tracks in downtown Lees Summit

data.title: Kitchen Nightmare Candidate
data.text: Awful service and the worst food I have been served in at least a decade. They should be embarrassed to serve what they serve. The food is greasy, salty, garlicky, and somehow they manage to burn the outside of the food, yet the inside is raw dough. They can't even do fries right! I barely ate anything, but the little I ate made my stomach churn and I almost threw up. If that wasn't enough, the acoustics are terrible and you have to shout to hold a conversation, even with nothing on in the background. The only thing that was good was the beer--they have a pretty good selection. If you go, stick to the liquids! Don't even touch their appetizers! Their food is nothing short of disgusting! By the way, this is only my third review and my first negative review. My other two were for extraordinary restaurants. You've really got to serve some disgusting slop to make me feel compelled to warn people.

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Everything you've said in your above review is not the feedback we ever receive. Could you please email me at julie@konradskc.com so I can here the details of your visit? Thanks.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lee's Summit Konrads
data.text: Great place, great staff and owners are quite friendly. We go at least once a month. The trivia contest is a draw on Tuesdays as well.

data.title: Diamond in the rough
data.text: Stopped by for lunch and what a surprise.  Great atmosphere, great food.  Servers always around if needing  anything. Definitely recommend it. Good location if travelling by rail. About 500 ft from the Amtrak station.  Good place to eat and  watch the trains go by on their way into Kansas City

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for stopping by. We love to hear your feedback and we appreciate you supporting local!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tasteless
data.text: Three hungry folks came in for lunch today.  We each ordered tea...I ordered the Cuban, wife ordered the blackened/bleu cheese burger, friend ordered the Reuben. My Cuban was tasteless, the pulled pork was dry...the best part about it was the pickles.  My fries were limp and just warm.  Wife had to keep adding salt to her supposedly highly seasoned burger.  Her cole slaw obviously came our if a plastic container.  Friend said her Reuben wasn't very good, but thought her green beans were great.  Even our iced tea tasted like it was mostly water.  Our waiter was friendly, but kept forgetting things we asked for.  The only reason this visit didn't get a "1-star" is that the decor was reasonable for a sports bar kind of place, and it appeared to be clean.  I won't be back

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for providing us with feedback. This is something we definitely do not want to hear. We take a lot of pride in the food we send out. We would love for you to give us another shot. Can you please email me at julie@konradskc.com so I can get further detail on your visit?
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great service with tasty dishes
data.text: Konrad's offers a very nice variety of dishes in a relaxed atmosphere. Our service was great and the food was very good.

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We love to hear that you had a great experience. Thank you for supporting local and thank you for supporting us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful family dining
data.text: We visited on a Saturday evening. Wife and I shared one of their wonderful pizzas. Daughter-in-law had their steak special. Food was hot and tasty. It was a little noisy but that is to be expected on a Saturday evening, especially when a fantasy football league was having their draft.  They have many beers available.  Live music is available some nights.

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Robert. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. We love to hear about your experience. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place!
data.text: This place is awesome! Service was great as well as the tenderloin. This is definitely an upswing to downtown lees summit. The place is very clean and the live music is great!

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so happy to hear you had a great time! Our number one priority is our customers and your feedback is appreciated. We hope you are able to visit again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Didn't Taste Good the First Time - Tasted Even Worse the Rest of The Day :(
data.text:
We had such high hopes when entering the doors here - this place looks like it has real history ( the building at least ) - It would have been great if the owner's of the establishment had done a little research and capitalized on that. 
The service here was really good except that our waitress was so very soft spoken you could barely hear her and we wondered how on earth she could do her job at night when this place is hopping with locals and a live band?
The menu looked varied and we had no problems making a choice. We ordered the beer pretzels with a spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, I ordered a chicken bacon swiss (no bacon) with fries and Matt ordered the Konrad's Club.
The Pretzels (served hot) were FULL of salt - don't get me wrong - we like salty pretzels but this was way over the top. They were also so very greasy they felt like they would literally slip out of your hands. The dip seemed seemed nothing more than a melted stick of butter with a bit of spinach and cheese flavor. The fries were coated heavy with a seasoned salt. The sandwiches were just average - not enough to save this meal for us. 
It was so greasy and heavy we both were burping our meals hours later. 
The service and ambiance alone can't make a meal or a good review - after all - we were there for a good meal, and that fell short to put it lightly.
Save this place for a night out for some drinks and maybe an appetizer when the visit hinges less on the food quality and more on the socializing, entertainment and booze.

owner_response.author: KonradsLS, Owner at Konrad's Kitchen and Tap House, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. We are very surprised to hear of your experience. You ordered three of our most popular items! I'm not 100% on the quality of our food coming up - but I do know it's the norm for it to be quite tasty going down. We consider ourselves a scratch kitchen since 95% of our items are house made. Everything you had is among those items. We do hope you give us another shot. In the future please feel free to notify us of discrepancies during your visit. We will gladly correct them on the spot. Thank you for supporting local!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
